I once read the patent for the Creativity Machine when I was asked about =
it a while ago.   I am not an expert on it and did not study it extensively=
, but I had trouble seeing a substantive insight that makes it work better =
than other such stochastic search technologies (like GAs).  It didn't seem =
to address the problems of dimensionality, representation, or search space =
in any new way.  There are some nice demos, especially of music, on their s=
ite, but I can't find any specifics on how exactly the music was represente=
d, so I am not sure if the talent behind it was ultimately with the develop=
er rather than the Creativity Machine itself.  All in all, I am not sure if=
 the Creativity Machine is really doing that much different from any other =
stochastic search.

ken
